intro: Romanschulzia resediflora, commonly known as the red-flowered romanschulzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy red flowers. The plant features strap-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped blooms. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Romanschulzia resediflora prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
